LONDON, Jan 2 The following FTSE 100 companies will go ex-dividend on Wednesday, after which investors will no longer qualify for the latest dividend payout. According to Reuters' calculations at current market prices, the effect would be to take 0.117 points off the index. COMPANY (RIC) DIVIDEND INDEX IMPACT (cents) (points) Experian Group (EXPN.L) 5.5 0.117
Mid-cap stocks expected to trade ex-dividend include:
